Choose a number of creatures up to your Charisma modifier that're within 30 feet of you; these creatures must make a Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws they make. On a successful save the creature can't be affected by this type of performance for 24 hours. A creature that is deafened or otherwise can't hear you is unaffected by this performance. You can maintain your performance on your turn as a bonus action.

entries.name: Folk
entries: During this performance your music enthrals all those who hear it. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, with advantage if you are currently fighting them, or they become charmed by you until your performance ends or someone in your party harms them. They will know they have been charmed when the performance ends. A creature that is deafened or otherwise can't hear you is unaffected by this performance. You can maintain your performance on your turn as a bonus action.

entries.name: Light
entries: During this performance you play an electrifying solo, your hands alight with magical fire. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet that can see you must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. On a successful save the creature can't be affected by this type of performance for 24 hours. A creature that is blinded or otherwise can't see you is unaffected by this performance. You can maintain your performance on your turn as a bonus action.

entries.name: Power
entries: During this performance your words inspire your allies with the power of your music. Choose a number of creatures up to your Charisma modifier that are within 30 feet of you. The chosen creatures may add your Charisma modifier to one ability check, attack roll, damage roll or saving throw on their turn. A creature that is deafened or otherwise can't hear you is unaffected by this performance. You can maintain your performance on your turn as a bonus action.

entries.name: Speed
entries: During this performance your rhythmic melodies synchronise the movement of your allies and yourself, enabling you to cover more ground than before. Choose a number of creatures up to your Charisma modifier that are within 30 feet of you. The chosen creatures are able to take the Dash action as a bonus action. If they can already do this their movement speed is doubled when not using the Dash action. A creature that is deafened or otherwise can't hear you is unaffected by this performance. If a creature moves further than 30 feet away from you on their turn they no longer receive this bonus unless they are once again within 30 feet of you at the start of their next turn whilst your performance is still active. You can maintain your performance on your turn as a bonus action.

Unless otherwise stated your performance and its effects last 1 minute; if you take damage whilst maintaining your performance roll a Concentration check, if you fail the performance and all related effects end immediately. You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: Man-Orges reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Man-Orges tend toward no particular alignment. They follow the alignment of their leaders.

entries.name: Size
entries: Man-Orges are around 7 to 8 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 420 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Tough
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 2, and it increases by 2 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Giant.
"Da boss Conan asked me what my job was an' I said it was to, uh, do what I was told. He said I was a genius and gave me another medal. I likes da Aldis army!" - Rogg, Man-Ogre

Man-Ogres have thick skin, powerfully muscular builds and are of monstrous size, as they stand around 7 to 8 feet tall. Though their Ogre heritage has led them to increase in physical size and strength, the Man-Ogre's intelligence declined to below average human levels. Possessed of little more than only primitive survival instincts, part of their nonhuman heritage involved the loss of the ability for more complex intellectual thought since philosophical matters were unnecessary in an environment marked by starvation and a constant fight for life.

Man-Ogres are said to be even less intelligent than some Orcs. However, the truth is that their intellects are not in fact stunted, but much more focused on matters such as survival. An affinity for magic is virtually unknown among Man-Ogres as a result. A Man-Ogre's speech patterns have been noted to be much the same as those observed in feral Orcs.

entries.name: Age
entries: Pups reach adulthood around 8 years of age. Due to their violent lifestyle many will be killed when they start showing signs of aging, around 30 years of age. Their full life expectancy is not known.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Gnolls do not follow any sort of code or rules; for the most part they are chaotic in nature. Due to their demonic connection many gnolls tend towards evil alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gnolls tend to be around 7 feet. They generally weigh between 250 and 310 lbs. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your fiendish heritage grants you the ability to see in dark conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: Due to your keen senses, you are proficient with the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Naturally Equipped
entries: You are never unarmed. You are proficient with your bite. As an action you may make a bite attack. It is a melee attack with a range of 5 feet and on a hit you deal 1d6 piercing damage; you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on your turn, you can take a bonus action to move up to half your speed and make a bite attack.

entries.name: Howl of the Pack
entries: Choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you within 30 feet. It can use it's reaction to make one weapon attack. After you use this feature, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnoll.

Gnoll legends trace the origin of their species back to a time when the demon lord Yeenoghu found his way to the Material Plane and ran amok. Packs of ordinary hyenas followed in his wake, scavenging the demon lord's kills. Those hyenas were transformed into the first gnolls, parading after Yeenoghu until he was banished back to the Abyss. The gnolls then scattered across the face of the world, a dire reminder of demonic power.

This is the tale gnoll mothers tell their pups and the story the scourge uses to exhort his troops. Whether it is truth or mere legend, it is easy to see the inspiration for the myth. A gnoll looks much like a humanoid hyena and shares many traits with the animal, including its haunting laughter, and the strength and savagery of these creatures is enough to suggest demonic blood; the typical gnoll band strikes without fear or mercy, tearing into enemies with the fury of fiends incarnate.

entries.name: Pack Mentality
entries: In spite of the savage nature of the gnolls, there are some aspects to their culture that are not inherently repulsive. Gnolls place a very strong value on family for instance, respecting blood ties perhaps more than any other aspect of a relationship. Though gnolls within a pack will commonly fight with each other for dominance, these battles are quickly forgotten after their resolution, and in most situations, gnolls of the same bloodline are loyal friends and allies to one another. These bloodlines are almost always traced maternally, through the female line.

This loyalty to family is particularly obvious during combat, either with rival gnoll packs or other races. Gnolls who fight side by side regularly throw away personal glory in order to help their brethren. Perhaps most surprisingly, when a gnoll is separated from their clan and family their instinctive need for such blood ties leads them to form a surrogate "pack" from those whom they choose to befriend. To these unlikely allies the gnoll is as loyal and faithful as they would be to their own brothers or sisters, embracing the outsiders as if they were family.

While all gnolls have an innate tendency for collecting souvenirs and trophies, nomadic packs, particularly the savage ones who have little contact with other races except during wartime, find few other ways to acquire technology, having crafted a handful of tools of their own. The result of this is that most gnolls rely on the other races as their source of wealth and technology; which extends to arms and weaponry, giving gnoll armour a unique aesthetic where each suit is typically kitbashed together from scavenged pieces found either on victims or abandoned.
Gnolls of all kinds have an affinity for hyenas, who many see as their brethren and whom they keep as pets or for hunting.

entries.name: Gnoll Names
entries: First names have a flow-y yet growl-like sound. Surnames are always the name of the pack they belong to. Pack names will be compounded words. They can describe either the members of the pack, or where that pack lives.

entries.name: Male Names
entries: Dagnyr, Dhyrn, Doryc, Ghyrryn, Gnasc, Gnoryc, Gnyrn, Hyrn, Lhoryn, Lhyr, Mognyr, Sorgnyn, Thyrn, Toryc, Yrgnyn, Yrych

entries.name: Female Names
entries: Dagnyra, Gnara, Gnora, Gnyrl, Hyra, Hyrgna, Lhyra, Lhyrl, Malgna, Myrl, Sargna, Shyrla, Tarnyra, Yrgna

entries.name: Pack Names
entries: Blackpaw, Mosshide, Mudsnout, Palemane, Redridge, Riverpaw, Rot Hide, Savage-Hill, Shadowhide, Stinkpelt, Wildpaw, Woodpaw

entries.name: Age
entries: Kitsune reach adulthood at 16, cease physical aging in their early 20s and can live several centuries.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Due to their mischievous nature Kitsune are often chaotic, with even the most skilled monks finding it difficult to ignore the desire to be a bit mischievous at times. Kitsune are known to be both good and evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kitsune are lithe but similar in size to humans, ranging from 5 to 6 feet tall. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your eyes have the thin slits and reflective nature of a foxes. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Weapon
entries: In your natural form you gain a Bite attack that does 1d4 plus your Strength modifier in piercing damage.

entries.name: Deceptive
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} skill.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Fox Magic
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell charm person} spell once per day as a 1st-level spell. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell alter self} spell once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Change Form
entries: As an action, you can change to your human form or revert to your natural form. You can assume the appearance of a specific single human form of the same sex, you always take this specific form when you use this ability, and you revert to your natural form if you fall unconscious. Your clothing and other equipment don't change in appearance, size, or shape to match your new form.

Should you take damage whilst in your human form roll a concentration check, on a failed check you revert to your natural form; this doesn't count as concentrating for the purposes of determining spell casting.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

Kitsune, or fox-folk, are vulpine shapeshifters known for their love of both trickery and art. Kitsune possess two forms: that of an attractive human of slender build with salient eyes, and their true form of an anthropomorphic fox. Despite an irrepressible penchant for deception, kitsune prize loyalty and make true companions.

They delight in the arts, particularly riddles and storytelling, and settle in ancestral clans, taking their wisdom from both the living and spirits. Quick-witted and nimble, kitsune make excellent bards and rogues. It is not uncommon for one to persue sorcery, while those few born with white fur and pale eyes usually become oracles.

In their natural form kitsune are anthropomorphic foxes, they commonly have fur in various shades of red and brown but it is not unknown for rare colours such as white and black to appear on occasion too. Their eyes have vertical slit pupils that have a range of colors from cobalt blue to golden yellow. They also have a long white-tipped tail that helps them balance on their digitigrade legs.

Kitsune have claws that, while more pronounced than a normal human's fingernails, are impractical to use in combat simply leaving the victim with shallow scratches instead of any more meaningful injuries. Their jaws on the other hand are deadly if one is not careful, and a kitsune may use their fangs as a last resort in close quarters combat.

entries.name: Kitsune Names
entries: Kitsune draw their names primarily from their own folk tales and fables as well as from the names of their ancestors, giving their spirits a new lease of life through the use of their names. Certain names in particular hold special meaning to kitsune, either an allegory to greater things or simply a reference to their personality.
Alongside their forenames kitsune will often have a family surname too.

entries.name: Male Names
entries: Akihiko (Bright Prince), Akito, Dai (Great/Large), Goharu, Hamon, Haru (Sunlight), Hikichi, Hiro (Generous), Hiroshi (Generous), Isuke, Kakoto, Keitsu, Kita, Makumi, Michi (Pathway), Michio (On The Right Path), Minori (Truth), Ryumichi, Ryuu (Dragon Spirit), Sadao (Decisive), Sahide, Seitomo, Shutari, Sutsuna, Takumi, Tatsuya (Assertive), Tetsuo (Wise Hero), Tomio (Treasured), Toshiyuki (Clever And Happy), Yasuyoshi (Calm), Yatsumi, Yujio

entries.name: Female Names
entries: Akira (Bright/Clear), Arisu (Noble Type), Aya (Colorful), Chikage, Futo, Hana (Flower), Hikari (Radiance), Hochiha, Ikyo, Jono, Kin (Gold), Kiruka, Kiyomi (Pure Beauty), Kou (Happiness), Koyo, Maeki, Mai (Dance), Miki (Beautiful Princess), Minako (Beautiful Child), Mutsuka, Muzuki, Naonoka, Narimi, Ritaru, Sayuri (Lily), Toshiko (Clever Child), Yasako, Yasuko (Peaceful Child), Yatoshi, Yuki (Snow)

entries.name: Age
entries: Rat-men reach adulthood by 4 to 6 months and can live up to 20 years but rarely do so.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Rat-men are fundamentally selfish, paranoid and prone to betrayal for their own interests. They tend to be chaotic evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: In terms of size, the average Rat-men is slight of build and can stand up to between four and six feet in height when not in their usual hunched-over posture. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your large teeth are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (perception) rolls that rely on smell.

entries.name: Plague Carrier
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage. You are immune to the effects of diseases but are still contagious for the next 24 hours, creatures you come into close contact with must save against the disease as if they'd been targeted by the source of the disease.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Suprise Attack
entries: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 2d6 damage to it.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Rat-men.

The Rat-men, sometimes known as the Ratmen, the Ratkin or the Children of the Horned Rat, are a malevolent and diabolical race of large humanoid rat-creatures that inhabits a massive inter-continental underground empire known in their tongue simply as the Under-Empire, where at the very heart lies the horrific city of the Horned Rat, the species capital city and the probable birthplace of the Rat-men race. The Rat-men as a whole are a cruel, treacherous and highly numerous species that have since spread their loathsome corruption to the farthest corners of the world.

entries.name: Rat-men Personality
entries: You can use the Rat-men Quirks table to determine a personality quirk for a rat-men character or to inspire a unique mannerism.

entries.caption: Rat-men
rows: Paranoid. You think everyone is out to get you. It's only a matter of time before they do.
Coward. You'll turn tail at the first sign of danger, and will avoid dying at all costs.
Unclean. You completely lack the concept of bathing, let alone personal hygiene.
Hunger. You're always so hungry you could eat a horse. In fact, you once did.
Fleas. You scratch and itch compulsively as if afflicted by fleas, whether you actually are or not.
Darkness. You've always much preferred the dark to any form of light, especially sunlight.
Fearless. You seemingly lack a sense of self preservation, eager to throw yourself at danger.
Schemer. They'll never see it coming, and then it'll be all yours for the taking.

entries.name: Rat-men Names
entries: Rat-men that survive long enough to reach maturity will choose themselves a "self name" that they'll refer to themselves as. Should a rat-men become more renown (or infamous) they may take on a "title name" related to what they're known for. Some of particular notoriety may only be known by their "title name" instead of their "self name".

entries.name: Self Names
entries: Chekch, Chel, Chut, Crin, Crun, Egzoch, Khikch, Kreech, Kretch, Krezkrot, Krueet, Okret, Qhigzatch, Qhit, Qrat, Skralk, Skret, Skruk, Snat, Strol, Stronq, Telk, Throl, Tin, Treeshqak, Ukulk, Viaxrik, Vokch, Vuk, Xacnon, Znilk

entries.name: Title Names
entries: Amberbark, Ashenstalker, Barbedbinder, Barbedmaw, Bitterfang, Blazingsnout, Boneflayer, Caskblood, Cindertail, Clawback, Covenmaster, Cravengazer, Crowripper, Duskcutter, Firecrest, Flintspine, Greatshrieker, Grimbreath, Grimfist, Ironchin, Keendigger, Kragthorn, Lowcleaver, Nightjaw, Quickrunner, Shadowchaser, Silentreaper, Skulltaker, Steelspire, Sternscar

feat.name: Bone'ead
entries: You are one of the rare Man-Ogres who, despite their primitive mind-set, exhibit a rare glimmer of intelligence. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn two maneuvers from the Battle Master archetype in the fighter class: {@optfeature Commander's Strike} and {@optfeature Pushing Attack}. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain two superiority dice, which are d6s (these dice are added to any superiority dice you have from another source). These dice are used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Brutal Strength
entries: Even amongst Man-Ogres you are considered to be strong and capable of impressive feats of brutish power. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your unarmed strike uses a d6 for damage.
You count as one size larger when grappling and your speed is not halved when moving a grappled creature if it is a smaller size than you.

When you hit with an attack using Strength, you can roll one of the attack's damage dice an additional time and add it as extra damage of the attack's damage type. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Loyal Bodyguard
entries: You are renowned for protecting your comrades from danger however you can and they feel reassured by your presence. You gain the following benefits:

items: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You also become the new target of the attack.

When an allied creature you can see within 5 feet of you fails a Strength, Dexterity or Constitution saving throw against an effect that deals damage, you can use your reaction to make them take only half of the damage. However you take the other half of the damage from the effect.
If you are providing cover to an allied creature, that creature is considered to be in three-quarters cover if they are within 5 feet of you.

feat.name: Unflinching Bulwark
entries: Your resilience knows no bounds as you shrug off attacks that would fell other creatures. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

You reduce all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage you take by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus. This reduction is done before any applicable resistances are taken into account.
You have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone or being stunned.

feat.name: Clever Disguise
entries: You're adept at keeping your true nature hidden and have even embraced more of your fey heritage than others. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item disguise kit|phb} if you didn't already have it.
You have advantage on concentration checks to maintain your change form feature.

You can use your change form feature to instead turn into a {@creature fox|KitsuneFF}. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the fox, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the fox. If the fox has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the fox's bonus instead of yours. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed and you can't wear any armor unless it is made to fit your fox form. You have disadvantage when using equipment meant for humanoids and cannot cast spells that require material components while in this form.

feat.name: Nine-tails
entries: You've learnt to tap into the greater magic power within yourself. You gain an additional tail for every two character levels you posses up to a maximum of 9. For each tail you have you gain a use of the following feature:

entries.name: Well of Arcana
entries: During a short rest you can expend one use of this feature to regain a 1st level spell slot. You may expend multiple uses of this feature to regain spell slots of higher levels with the uses expended being equal to the spell slot's level (maximum of 3rd level).
You regain one use of this feature after finishing a long rest.

feat.name: Poisonous Passion
entries: You have a fervent fixation with poisons and all manner of similar deadly concoctions. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|phb} and the {@item poisoner's kit|phb}.
You learn the {@spell poison spray} cantrip if you don't already know it, Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

During a short rest you can use 5gp worth of materials to craft a number of poison bombs up to your Intelligence modifier. You can throw a single bomb up to 30ft. on your turn. On a hit it deals 1d4 poison damage and the creature must succeed a Constitution save with a DC equal to 10 plus your Intelligence modifier or be poisoned for 1d4 turns.

feat.name: Savage Creature
entries: You follow your base instincts and impulses, giving you a bestial, feral demeanour. You gain the following benefits:

items: While you aren't holding anything in your hands your base walking speed increases by 10 feet.
You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to track another creature.
You can use your action to consume the flesh and blood of a dead organic creature within 5 feet of you, gaining hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

feat.name: Survival Tactics
entries: You always have a trick up your sleeve to avoid a fatal blow, but a brush with death is still as scary as ever. When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You become {@condition frightened} of whatever dealt the triggering damage to you for 24 hours. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The fox has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the fox moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 9} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the fox can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Elude
entries: The fox adds 2 to its AC against one opportunity attack that would hit it.
